alert.note: Alert for Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Crook County through 630 PM MDT... At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Devils Tower Junction, or 15 miles west of Sundance, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Devils Tower Junction around 610 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Warren Peak. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 161 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.
